BiblioData.Title: NANOTUBE ASSEMBLY
BiblioData.Abstract: Methods and articles providing for precise aligning, positioning, shaping, and linking of nanotubes and carbon nanotubes. An article comprising: a solid surface comprising at least two different surface regions including: a first surface region which comprises an outer boundary and which is adapted for carbon nanotube adsorption, and a second surface region which is adapted for preventing carbon nanotube adsorption, the second region forming an interface with the outer boundary of the first region, at least one carbon nanotube which is at least partially selectively adsorbed at the interface. The shape and size of the patterns on the surface and the length of the carbon nanotube can be controlled to provide for selective interfacial adsorption.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:
1. An article comprising:
a solid surface comprising at least two different surface regions including:
a first surface region which comprises an outer boundary and which is adapted for carbon nanotube adsorption, and
a second surface region which is adapted for preventing carbon nanotube adsorption, the second region forming an interface with the outer boundary of the first region,
at least one carbon nanotube which is at least partially selectively adsorbed at the interface.
2. The article according to claim 1, wherein the first region comprises hydrophilic groups.
3. The article according to claim 1, wherein the first region comprises carboxyl groups.
4. The article according to claim 1, wherein the second region comprises hydrophobic groups.
5. The article according to claim 1, wherein the second region comprises alkyl groups.
6. The article according to claim 1, wherein the first region comprises hydrophilic groups, and the second region comprises hydrophobic groups.
7. The article according to claim 1, wherein the first region comprises carboxyl groups, and the second region comprises alkyl groups.
8. The article according to claim 1, comprising a plurality of first surface regions, and a plurality of second surface regions, and a plurality of interfaces.
9. The article according to claim 1, wherein the first surface region comprises a dot, a ring, a line, or a curvilinear structure.
10. The article according to claim 1, comprising a plurality of first surface regions which form a periodic array.
11. The article according to claim 1, wherein the carbon nanotube is a multi-walled, a double-walled, or a single wall carbon nanotube.
12. The article according to claim 1, wherein the carbon nanotube is a single wall carbon nanotube.
13. The article according to claim 1, wherein a plurality of carbon nanotubes are adsorbed which have an average length of at least 0.4 microns.
14. The article according to claim 1, wherein carbon nanotube has a length of about 10 nm to about 50 nm.
15. The article according to claim 1, wherein the carbon nanotube forms an arc or a circle.
16. The article according to claim 1, wherein the first surface region is a dot having a diameter of about one micron or less.
17. The article according to claim 1, wherein the first region forms a dot having a dot diameter, a ring having a ring diameter, and the nanotube has a length which is longer than the diameter.
18. The article according to claim 1, wherein the carbon nanotube is longer than the outer boundary.
19. The article according to claim 6, wherein the carbon nanotube is a single wall carbon nanotube.

20. The article according to claim 7, wherein the carbon nanotube is a single wall carbon nanotube, and wherein a plurality of carbon nanotubes are selectively adsorbed at the interface and are linked together.
21. A method comprising:
providing a solid surface comprising at least two different surface regions including:
a first surface region which comprises an outer boundary and which is adapted for carbon nanotube adsorption, and
a second surface region which is adapted for preventing carbon nanotube adsorption, the second region forming an interface with the outer boundary of the first region,
providing a liquid composition comprising a plurality of carbon nanotubes in at least one liquid solvent,
placing the liquid composition on the solid surface, so that at least one carbon nanotube adsorbs to the surface,
removing the at least one liquid solvent,
wherein the at least one carbon nanotube is at least partially selectively adsorbed at the interface.
22. The method according to claim 21, wherein the carbon nanotube is a multi-walled, a double-walled, or a single wall carbon nanotube.
23. The method according to claim 21, wherein the carbon nanotubes are assembled as continuous ropes from individual nanotubes.
24. The method according to claim 21, wherein the first region comprises hydrophilic groups, and the second region comprises hydrophobic groups.
25. The method according to claim 21, wherein the placing step is carried out with use of a flat, thin nozzle.
26. The method according to claim 21, wherein the first or second region is formed by depositing a patterning compound on a substrate from a tip.
27. The method according to claim 26, wherein the tip is a nanoscopic tip.
28. The method according to claim 26, wherein the tip is an atomic force microscope tip.
29. The method according to claim 26, wherein the tip is a hollow tip.
30. The method according to claim 26, wherein the tip comprises a microfluidic channel running through the middle of the tip.
31. An article comprising:
a solid surface comprising at least two different surface regions including:
a first surface region which comprises an outer boundary and which is adapted for nanotube or nanowire adsorption, and
a second surface region which is adapted for preventing nanotube or nanowire adsorption, the second region forming an interface with the outer boundary of the first region,
at least one nanowire or nanotube which is sufficiently long with respect to the size and shape of the first surface region so that it is at least partially selectively adsorbed at the interface.
32. The article according to claim 31, wherein the outer boundary is circular.
33. The article according to claim 31, wherein the nanowire or nanotube forms a ring.
34. The article according to claim 31, wherein the outer boundary is circular and the nanowire or nanotube forms a ring.
35. The article according to claim 31, wherein the first region comprises a ring or a circular dot.
36. The article according to claim 31, wherein the nanowire is a silicon nanowire or the nanotube is a carbon nanotube which is a multi-walled, a double-walled, or a single wall carbon nanotube.
37. The article according to claim 31, wherein the article is a thin film having a film height of about 10 nm or less.
38. The article according to claim 31, wherein the article is a filtration membrane.
39. The article according to claim 31, wherein the first region or the second region have a lateral dimension which is about 100 nm or less.
40. The article according to claim 31, wherein the article provides a nanotube or nanowire packing density of at least 5*10<7> /cm<2> .
